description: The United Nations' polio vaccination campaign continued this weekend in Gaza, even as Israel continued striking other parts of the strip. Elizabeth Palmer reports.
title: Polio vaccination effort goes on as Israeli strikes continue in Gaza

description: A New CBS News poll shows Vice President Kamala Harris with a slight edge in Michigan and Wisconsin while in Pennsylvania she remains even with former President Trump. The two will square off in their first debate Tuesday. Weijia Jian has more.
title: Polls show tight race headed into Harris, Trump debate

description: The Line Fire burning in San Bernardino County in California has more than quadrupled in size over the weekend, prompting thousands to evacuate. Elise Preston has more on the fast-growing blaze.
title: Line Fire prompts thousands to evacuate

description: Authorities are searching for a suspect who wounded five people in a shooting on a highway in Kentucky on Saturday night. All five victims were stable on Sunday but some had "serious" injuries, authorities said. Cristian Benavides reports.
title: Manhunt underway for suspect who shot 5 on Kentucky highway

description: On September 11, 2001, 343 members of the Fire Department of New York perished while trying to rescue people trapped in the World Trade Center. Scott Pelley speaks with firefighters who were there that day and the loved ones of those who never made it home.
title: 60 Minutes remembers 9/11: The FDNY

description: On September 11, 2001, 343 members of the Fire Department of New York perished while trying to rescue people trapped in the World Trade Center. Scott Pelley speaks with firefighters who were there that day and the loved ones of those who never made it home.
title: 9/11: The FDNY | 60 Minutes

description: Only 29 minutes passed between the two World Trade Center towers falling. CBS News photojournalist Mark LaGanga captured the eerie scene up close
title: Rare video from ground zero on 9/11

description: The children left behind, the World Trade Center site frozen in time, the band accompanying endless funerals: A look back at the memorable 9/11 stories told on 60 Minutes.
title: How 60 Minutes reported on the September 11th terrorist attacks

description: Jannik Sinner defeated Taylor Fritz 6-3, 6-4, 7-5 to win the U.S. Open men's championship less than three weeks after being exonerated in a doping case.
title: Jannik Sinner wins U.S. Open men's final with win over Taylor Fritz

description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald are set to face off for the first time on Tuesday.
title: How Trump and Harris are preparing for their first debate of 2024

description: "There's no question about it. It's close here in North Carolina," North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan."
title: North Carolina governor: If Harris wins state, "she is the next president"

description: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, former U.N. ambassador Nikki Haley and Rep. Michael McCaul join Margaret Brennan.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 8, 2024

description: Two NATO members, Romania and Latvia, say Russian drones have violated their airspace.
title: NATO members Romania, Latvia say Russian drones violated their airspace

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," in the wake of a forthcoming GOP report on Afghanistan, House Foreign Affairs Committee chairman Rep. Michael McCaul discusses its findings with Margaret Brennan. Plus, Brennan speaks with former U.N. ambassador Nikki Haley.
title: 9/8: Face the Nation

description: Nikki Haley says she's supporting former President Donald Trump because she supports his policies, but she doesn't agree with him on everything.
title: Nikki Haley says she doesn't "agree with Trump 100% of the time"

description: Throughout his career, Will Jennings wrote for artists like Steve Winwood, Whitney Houston, Eric Clapton, B.B. King and Mariah Carey, among others.
title: Will Jennings, Oscar-winning co-writer of "My Heart Will Go On," dies at 80

description: Democratic Rep. Jim Himes of Connecticut, the ranking member on the House Intelligence Committee, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that President Biden did not come to office with an agenda on Afghanistan, as Republicans have alleged, but he came to office with a "binding agreement negotiated by President Trump."
title: Rep. Jim Himes says Biden came to office with "binding agreement" on Afghanistan from Trump

description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on...North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, who was considered to be Kamala Harris' running mate, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that if the vice president wins his state, "she is the next president of the United States", House Foreign Affairs Committee chairman Rep. Michael McCaul, Republican of Texas, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the GOP-led investigation into the Afghanistan withdrawal will continue "well after the election", and Democratic Rep. Jim Himes of Connecticut, the ranking member on the House Intelligence Committee, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that President Biden did not come to office with an agenda on Afghanistan, as Republicans have alleged, but he came to office with a "binding agreement negotiated by President Trump."
title: Face the Nation: Cooper, McCaul, Himes

description: Kendrick Lamar will headline his first Super Bowl Halftime Show at the event in New Orleans next year.
title: Kendrick Lamar will headline the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show

description: North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, who was considered to be Kamala Harris' running mate, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that if the vice president wins his state, "she is the next president of the United States."
title: North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper says Kamala Harris "knows we are in play"

description: House Foreign Affairs Committee chairman Rep. Michael McCaul, Republican of Texas, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the GOP-led investigation into the Afghanistan withdrawal will continue "well after the election." The committee is releasing a report on Monday based off their findings.
title: Rep. Michael McCaul says Afghanistan investigation will go on "well after the election"

description: As a new CBS News poll shows that a tight race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump in the battleground states of Pennsylvania, Wisconsin and Michigan, Harris and Trump will meet on the debate stage on Tuesday. Weijia Jiang reports from Pittsburgh, where Harris is campaigning ahead of the debate.
title: Kamala Harris campaigns in Pittsburgh ahead of crucial debate

description: Former U.N. ambassador Nikki Haley, who challenged former President Donald Trump in the primary but is now campaigning for him, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that Sen. JD Vance's comments about childless women are "not helpful."
title: Nikki Haley says JD Vance's comments on childless women are "not helpful"

title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 8, 2024

description: Tyreek Hill was stopped by police for a traffic violation, according to the team.
title: Dolphins Tyreek Hill briefly detained by police near Hard Rock Stadium

description: The House Foreign Affairs Committee details the panel's two-year investigation into the 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal in a forthcoming report.
title: GOP-led House panel says Biden administration misled public on Afghanistan exit

description: A Filipino pastor on the FBI's most wanted list for his alleged role in a trafficking scheme was arrested, officials in the Philippines said Sunday.
title: Filipino pastor wanted by U.S. for trafficking arrested, officials say

description: We leave you this Sunday morning under the watchful eyes of Washington, Jefferson, Lincoln and Theodore Roosevelt, carved into Mt. Rushmore in the Black Hills of South Dakota. Videographer: David Bhagat.
title: Nature: Mt. Rushmore in South Dakota

description: The "Sunday Morning" senior contributor notes that "whoever gets the most votes" does not necessarily mean victory - now more than ever.
title: Ted Koppel on taking election victories for granted

description: As disinformation and conspiracy theories proliferate online in algorithm-fueled chaos, artificial intelligence is making it even harder for us to tell fact from fiction, spelling trouble for our impending election.
title: Fake news, social media, and "The Death of Truth"

description: As disinformation and conspiracy theories proliferate online in algorithm-fueled chaos, artificial intelligence is making it even harder for us to tell fact from fiction. "Sunday Morning" senior contributor Ted Koppel examines the consequences of fake news on the election with Steven Brill, author of "The Death of Truth."
title: Fake news and "The Death of Truth"

description: If you listen to polls and pundits, you may assume that politics has polarized Americans. But while we tend to have an exaggerated idea of what other people believe, statistics show Americans actually agree on a whole lot.
title: Reality check: How divided is America, really?

description: If you listen to polls and pundits, you may assume that politics has polarized Americans. But correspondent David Pogue points out that, while we tend to have an exaggerated idea of what other people believe, statistics show Americans actually agree on a whole lot.
title: Reality Check: How divided is America, really?

description: Boeing said 33,000 workers represented by the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers would get pay raises of 25% over the four-year contract.
title: Boeing reaches tentative deal to avoid strike by more than 30,000 machinists

description: As Americans have become more polarized, Hollywood appears to have shied away from telling overtly political stories. But some political messages fly under the radar.
title: Has Hollywood abandoned the political movie?

description: As Americans have become more polarized, has Hollywood shied away from telling overtly political stories? Turner Classic Movies host Ben Mankiewicz talks with actor Martin Sheen, who famously played a president on the long-running TV series "The West Wing"; with film professor Annette Insdorf and critic Michael Schulman, about Hollywood's long tradition of political films; and former studio head Michael Lynton, on the thinking behind risk-averse film studios.
title: The power of politics on screen

description: Tom Brady is back! Find out how to watch Brady's NFL broadcast debut today.
title: How to watch Tom Brady's NFL broadcast debut

description: The Las Vegas Raiders vs. Los Angeles Chargers Week 1 NFL game will be played today. Find out how to watch.
title: How to watch the Raiders vs. Chargers NFL game today

description: Three female Republican legislators bucked their party to join a Democrat and an Independent in filibustering South Carolina's near-total ban on abortion. For their efforts, the three lost their party's primaries, but say they're proud of what they accomplished.
title: South Carolina's "Sister Senators" on finding common ground

description: In South Carolina, three Republican State Senators – Katrina Shealy, Sandy Senn and Penry Gustafson – bucked their party to join Democrat Margie Bright Matthews and Independent Mia McLeod in filibustering their state's near-total ban on abortion and halting its passage three times. For their efforts, Shealy, Senn and Gustafson lost their party's primaries, and faced threats and harassment. They talk with correspondent Lee Cowan about the price they paid for their principles, and what they gained by reaching across the aisle.
title: Lessons from South Carolina's "Sister Senators"

description: The number of Americans who think that crime rates are going up hasn't been this high in decades. But FBI statistics show that perception and reality are two very different things.
title: Reality check: What we get wrong about crime

description: The number of Americans who think that crime rates are going up hasn't been this high in decades. And yet, FBI statistics show that crime rates (from violent crimes like murders, to property crimes like burglary) have actually steadily dropped for 30 years. Correspondent David Pogue looks at how, when it comes to the public's attitudes on crime, reality and perception are two different things.
title: Reality Check: What we get wrong about crime

description: In Florida, where nearly 27% of the labor force is foreign-born, state politicians are passing some of the harshest anti-illegal immigration laws in the country. Agriculture is big business in the Sunshine State, but with an estimated half of all farm workers in the country illegally, Florida's new laws are having significant consequences for farm owners. Correspondent Martha Teichner examines how a state that needs more workers is grappling with the consequences of cracking down on the undocumented.
title: Immigration laws raising issues for Florida growers

description: It's an election year, when sales of American flags usually spike. But 2024 is different; pride in flying the Stars and Stripes has become more partisan. From militants weaponizing the flag to activists creating their own flag variants, "Sunday Morning" contributor Kelefa Sanneh looks at why most Americans want to claim the flag that unites us as their own.
title: Flying the flag

description: The economy is the #1 issue for voters, and polls say most Americans, when asked about the economy, are pessimistic. But according to many indicators, the economy is actually doing quite well. So, why the disparity?
title: Reality check: What's up with the economy?

description: The economy is the number one issue for voters going to the ballot box this November, and polls say most Americans, when asked about the economy, are pessimistic. But according to many economic indicators, the economy is actually doing quite well. So, why the disparity? Correspondent David Pogue talks with economics professor Justin Wolfers about what feeds people's misperceptions of America's post-pandemic economy.
title: Reality check: What's up with the economy?

description: Some songs have become intertwined with campaigns, from Lee Greenwood's "God Bless the U.S.A.," to Beyoncé's "Freedom." But sometimes artists don't want their songs to be used by a particular candidate – and sometimes they sue!
title: A political playlist: The fight over campaign songs

description: Music has helped set the stage for politicians for generations, and some songs have become intertwined with campaigns, from Lee Greenwood's "God Bless the U.S.A.," to Beyoncé's "Freedom." But sometimes artists don't want their songs to be used by a particular candidate – and sometimes they sue! Correspondent Tracy Smith looks at when the playing of political anthems segues into copyright infringement.
title: Harmony vs. discord: Music in political campaigns

title: Transcript: Nikki Haley on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 8, 2024

description: In a suburb of Milwaukee, visitors to the Wisconsin State Fair could partake of pig races and deep-fried foods on a stick – and also talk politics with "Sunday Morning" senior contributor Ted Koppel, who asked Wisconsinites why they were backing their chosen candidates in the presidential election.
title: Politics (and deep-fried pickles) at the Wisconsin State Fair

description: Pope Francis emphasized the importance of the Catholic Church reaching marginalized groups while in Papua New Guinea, a nation stricken by poverty.
title: Pope Francis visits Papua New Guinea with humanitarian aid

description: Numerous nations, including the United States, have refused to recognize Nicolas Maduro as the winner of the presidential election.
title: Venezuela says presidential opposition leader has left country

description: Angel Reese injured her wrist in the Chicago Sky's victory over the Los Angeles Sparks Friday, in which she recorded another one of her signature double-doubles.
title: Angel Reese announces season-ending injury

description: Ashley Benefield, dubbed the "Black Swan," took the stand in her own defense during her trial for the murder of her estranged husband. Prosecutors say she killed Doug Benefield so she would have sole custody of their daughter.
title: What led a former ballerina to fatally shoot her husband?

description: More than 500 homes are under a mandatory evacuation order in the city of Highland due to the growing Line Fire.
title: Line Fire explodes in size in San Bernardino County, evacuations ordered

description: On any given Wednesday in the heart of San Francisco, a unique community comes to life. They're known as slackliners, an eclectic group of people connected by their love for balance, precision and a touch of daring. Itay Hod has more.
title: How the trend of slacklining is gaining momentum

description: Early Saturday morning, a chapter of the ongoing space saga involving two U.S. astronauts came to a close when Boeing's Starliner capsule returned to earth from the International Space Station, but with no one aboard. Mark Strassmann has the latest.
title: Boeing's Starliner returns safely to Earth, but without crew

description: Thousands of Israeli demonstrators took to the streets again Saturday, demanding their government make a deal to bring Hamas-held hostages home. Rather than work towards an agreement to release the hostages and bring a cease-fire to suffering Gazan Palestinians, Israeli protesters accuse Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of stalling. Elizabeth Palmer reports from Tel Aviv.
title: Thousands of Israeli protesters call for hostage deal

description: The suspect's grandfather also told CBS News that the boy texted his mother on the morning of the shooting, "I'm sorry."
title: Georgia suspect's grandmother visited school one day before shooting

description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are getting ready for their debate Tuesday in Philadelphia, but in vastly different ways. Weijia Jiang reports.
title: Harris, Trump preparing for debate, but in different ways

description: The grandfather of the 14-year-old suspect in the Apalachee High School shooting in northern Georgia told CBS News in a phone interview that the boy texted his mother on the morning of the shooting, "I'm sorry." Dave Malkoff has more.
title: Georgia suspect texted mother on day of shooting, family says

description: The Philadelphia Eagles and Green Bay Packers faced off Friday night in Sao Paulo, Brazil, in what marked the NFL's first ever game in South America. Manuel Bojorquez was there for the historic event.
title: Thousands pack Sao Paulo stadium for first-ever NFL game in South America

description: Authorities said the suspect was at large in what it described as an active shooter situation.
title: Multiple people shot along Kentucky highway; suspect at large, authorities say

title: "CBS Weekend News" headlines for Saturday, Sept. 7, 2024
